subSubSection.paragraph:
Basionym :
Cypripedium villosum Lindl., Gard. Chron. 1854: 135
, 1854. Type :— MYANMAR . Mon State : Mawlamyine District ,
Lobb 179
( holotype : K-LINDL ; isotype: W-R 7159 )
.

Homotypic synonym:
Cordula villosa (Lindl.) Rolfe, Orchid Rev.
20: 2, 1912.

Heterotypic synonyms:
Cypripedium boxallii Rchb.
f., Gard. Chron. , n.s., 7: 367, 1877.
Paphiopedilum boxallii
(Rchb.f.) Pfitzer in H.G.A.Engler & K.A.E.Prantl (eds.),
Nat . Pflanzenfam.
2 (6): 84, 1889.
Cypripedium villosum Lindl. var. boxallii
(Rchb.f.) H.J.Veitch, Man. Orch. Pl. 4: 54, 1889.
Paphiopedilum villosum (Lindl.) Stein var. boxallii
(Rchb.f.) Stein, Orchid.-Buch : 490, 1892.
Cordula boxallii
(Rchb.f.) Rolfe, Orchid Rev. 20: 2, 1912. Type:— MYANMAR . Mon State: Mawlamyine District, Boxall s.n. ( holotype : W-R 7157).

Cypripedium villosum
Lindl. var. aureum B.S.Williams, Orch.
-Grow. Man. , ed. 7: 311, 1894.
Paphiopedilum villosum (Lindl.) Stein var. aureum (B.S.Williams) Pfitzer
in H.G.A. Engler (ed.),
Pflanzenr. , IV
50 (12): 12: 73, 1903. Type :— MYANMAR . Mon State : Mawlamyine District , cult.
Williams s.n.
( holotype : not located).

Cypripedium vernayi
Kingdon-Ward, Gard. Chron.
, ser. 3, 104: 458, 1938, nom. prov. Basis for name: MYANMAR . Kachin State : Myitkyina District ,
1525 m
,
26 Nov 1938
, Kingdon-Ward 33 (AMES, NY).

Specimens examined:—
KACHIN . Putao District : without collector s.n. ( SING [spirit]); Myitkyina District : basis for name cited
.
CHIN . Mindat District :
19 Dec 2014
,
Kim s.n.
, photo
.
BAGO . Taungoo District :
Parish 92
( K )
.
MON . Mawlamyine District : types ; same loc.,
Parish s.n.
( K )
;
same loc.,
1065 m
,
29 Jan 1912
,
Lace 5645
( E , K )
.
Also reported from
Sagaing and Tanintharyi regions by
Kress et al. (2003: 85)
and from Mandalay Region and Shan State by Saw Lwin (2007: 249) , but we have not seen material from these areas.
Distribution:— The eastern Himalayas, northeastern India , Myanmar , Thailand , Indochina and southwestern China .
Note:— Several varieties have been proposed, no doubt most originating in Myanmar .

Paphiopedilum wardii
Summerh., Gard. Chron.
, ser. 3, 92: 446, 1932. Type :— MYANMAR . Upper part: ex
Kingdon- Ward s.n.
, cult.
RBG Kew s.n.
( holotype : K)

Homotypic synonym:
Cypripedium wardii (Summerh.) Curtis, Orchid Rev.
41: 2, 1933, nom. illeg. [non Rolfe 1913].

Heterotypic synonyms:
Paphiopedilum wardii Summerh. var. alboviride O.Gruss & Roeth, Orchidee
(Hamburg) 49: 143, 1998. Type :— MYANMAR . Without locality: without collector s.n. ( holotype : HAL )
.

Paphiopedilum burmanicum
J.Yong Zhang & Z.J.Liu, Acta Phytotax. Sin.
39: 564, 2001. Type :— MYANMAR . Without locality:
Liu 21022
( holotype : NOCC).

Cypripedium wardianum E.W.Cooper, Roy. Hort. Soc. Dict. Gard.
2: 621, 1951, nom.

Specimens examined:— UPPER
MYANMAR . Type . KACHIN . Putao District :
1220–1525 m
,
29 Dec 1930
,
Kingdon- Ward 9070
( BM , K ); same loc.,
1220–1525 m
,
7 Apr 1953
,
Kingdon-Ward 20637
( BM ); Myitkyina District :
1220−1525 m
,
6 Feb 1939
,
Kingdon-Ward 272
( NY ); same loc.,
1525 m
,
7 Mar 1939
, Kingdon-Ward 377 ( AMES , NY ). WITHOUT
LOCALITY.
Types ;
Kingdon-Ward s.n.
( K ). Reported from Sagaing Region , Chin State and Mandalay Region by
Kress et al. (2003: 85)
, but we have not seen material from these areas
.
Distribution:— Myanmar , southwestern China and possibly northeastern India .

Notes:—
Discovered by F . Kingdon-Ward during an expedition to the Nogmung area of Putao District (Kachin State) in 1920. For a long time, it was considered endemic to Myanmar until populations were also discovered in China (southwestern Yunnan ). We have followed
Liu et al. (2009)
in treating
P. burmanicum
as a synonym
.
